oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mt. Zion Baptist: front view
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of church viewed from front. Brick facade contains central double doors, three steps, and a large cross above the doorway. A cornerstone is visible on the lower-right side of the facade. Section of facade beneath the cross is wood painted red. This painted wood matches that of the gable-roofed steeple. To the left of the church, a miniature version of the church sits atop four poles.

Mt. Zion Baptist's current church building dates from 1964. Since the building's construction, changes to the facade and rear of the church have occurred. Another African American church, St. Paul AME, resides just down the road from Mt. Zion Baptist.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee;
steeples; double doors; steps; cornerstones;
